text: have not run a full data analysis on this yet but seems like horse racing place markets are very low matched volumes relative to win only. any reason for this? why don’t punters like place markets? or is this a betfair only anomaly and bookmakers see a lot more interest in place markets.

elements.text: have not run a full data analysis on this yet but seems like horse racing place markets are very low matched volumes relative to win only. any reason for this? why don’t punters like place markets? or is this a betfair only anomaly and bookmakers see a lot more interest in place markets.

text: I think favourite long shot bias means punters prefer betting at longer odds which you don’t see so much when betting to place

elements.text: I think favourite long shot bias means punters prefer betting at longer odds which you don’t see so much when betting to place

text: or simpy easier to understand the market?

elements.text: or simpy easier to understand the market?

text: (not sure)

elements.text: (not sure)

text: Place pricing is more difficult. It's well known that if favourites don't win, they are far less likely to come second or third as their odds might suggest

elements.text: Place pricing is more difficult. It's well known that if favourites don't win, they are far less likely to come second or third as their odds might suggest

text: And the Harville method is only a rough estimate - real data gives different values (I did the analysis over 10 years for Australian racing)

elements.text: And the Harville method is only a rough estimate - real data gives different values (I did the analysis over 10 years for Australian racing)

text: And that wasn't for using in place markets, BTW

elements.text: And that wasn't for using in place markets, BTW

text: I think on the Betfair side things are not helped by the fact that there are multiple place markets sometimes. Particularly in larger fields.

elements.text: I think on the Betfair side things are not helped by the fact that there are multiple place markets sometimes. Particularly in larger fields.

text: On Betfair I think the place markets go on the basic rules (GB and IRE) which is why they offer more markets on the larger fields. Definitely there were some place markets for first 6 finishers at Royal Ascot this year. I guess this just thins out the place money even more.

elements.text: On Betfair I think the place markets go on the basic rules (GB and IRE) which is why they offer more markets on the larger fields. Definitely there were some place markets for first 6 finishers at Royal Ascot this year. I guess this just thins out the place money even more.

text: I tend to throw away theory and go from actual data. My data set was around 10 years of Australian racing results (I think around 150,000 races). You can't draw a conclusion from a handful of results at one track. I also think that different countries would tend to have different "results"

elements.text: I tend to throw away theory and go from actual data. My data set was around 10 years of Australian racing results (I think around 150,000 races). You can't draw a conclusion from a handful of results at one track. I also think that different countries would tend to have different "results"
